definition[0]: to mention a subject or start to talk about it
example[0]: Why did you have to bring up the subject of money?
definition[1]: to look after and influence a child until he or she is grown up
example[1]: He was brought up by his grandparents.
example[2]: I was brought up a Catholic.
note[0]: be brought up (as) a Catholic/Muslim etc
example[3]: In my day, children were brought up to respect the law.
note[1]: bring somebody up to do something
definition[2]: to make something appear on a computer screen
example[4]: Can you bring up the list of candidates again?
definition[3]: if you bring food up, it comes back up from your stomach and out of your mouth
example[5]: I had a sandwich for lunch and promptly brought it up again.
definition[4]: to charge someone with a particular crime and make them go to a court to be judged
example[6]: He was brought up before a magistrate, charged with dangerous driving.
definition[5]: to surprise someone and make them suddenly stop talking or doing something
example[7]: Her question brought me up short.
